intro: Corydalis delavayi var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf corydalis, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. It prefers cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, particularly for rock gardens and shady borders.
